titleInfo.title: Cane Ridge Cumberland Presbyterian Church, Antioch, Tennessee, n.d.

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A Metro Historical Commission of Nashville and Davidson County marker located on Old Hickory Blvd. south of Red Apple, Antioch, Tennessee commemorating the Cane Ridge Cumberland Presbyterian Church. The plaque reads: “Cane Ridge Cumberland Presbyterian Church, built in 1859, replaced a log building which occupied land donated by Edwin Austin & Thomas Boaz in 1826. One of the best known pastors was Hugh Bone Hill who also preached at the Jerusalem Church in Rutherford County. Isaac Johnson, a Revolutionary War soldier, died 1839 & is buried in the church cemetery.” Forms part of the Bill Goodman Photographic Slides Collection. 1 35 mm negative.
